result.execSummary:
The defendant Davon Wesley Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Davon Wesley Barnett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Davon Wesley Barnett was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Davon Wesley Barnett was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Davon Wesley Barnett was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC request to clarify judgment of conviction (count one).

Defendant Davon Wesley Barnett in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing continued from the morning session. Statements by defense counsel & defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, consecutive to all counts and any other sentence, credit for 74 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS & 6 MONTHS. Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. -Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation on counts 2 & 4, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court WAIVED DNA sample, previously provided.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time, consecutive to all counts and any all other sentences. The Court STAYED Sentence for 2 YEARS of PROBATION.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time, consecutive to all counts and any all other sentences. The Court STAYED Sentence for 2 YEARS of PROBATION.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 50 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim or her children.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Probation Review Hearing to be set 100 DAYS after release by DOC Agent.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Sentencing proceeded. Statements from the state.  Additional Statements from the victim. Additional Statements from Lydia D. Court reviewed and returned photographs to the state. Due to the lateness of the hour court adjourned this matter for a continued Sentencing. Case passed to 1:30 PM in branch 23 for Continued Sentencing.

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 5 Dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 3 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Davon Wesley Barnett in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Davon Wesley Barnett in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state the court REMOVED the Repeater enhancer from Counts 1, 2 & 4 (939.62(1)(a)).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court.

Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
